column8: E. Asia - C. and E. China in Hubei and Sichuan.
column16: Stylophorum lasiocarpum is a PERENNIAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft) by 0.5 m (1ft 8in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 7.  It is in flower in May. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs).  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland). It prefers  moist soil.

column25: Requires a leafy soil in a cool sheltered position[187]. Plants are hardy to around -15°c[187]. Cultivated in China for the medicinal qualities of the thick root which contains a red juice[187]. This species, unlike most members of the family Papaveraceae, transplants without difficulty[200].
column26: Seed - sow in situ from late winter to late spring or late summer to late autumn. Division in March[111].
